alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Coastal Waldo; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 3:20AM EDT until March 15 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TODAY INTO WEDNESDAY... .Rapidly strengthening low pressure approaches southern New England this morning, and remains in the Gulf of Maine into tomorrow. Snow continues overspreading the area during the morning hours today. Greatest snowfall will likely fall at higher terrain across the Monadnocks, Sunapee, the Ossippees, and White Mountains. At lower elevations, heavy and wet snow is expected, likely causing scattered power outages today and tonight. Gusty northeast to north winds of 40 to 55 mph this afternoon and evening could accentuate the power outage risk this afternoon. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine to create low visibility and dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could bring some impacts to the morning commute, but much greater impacts are expected during the evening commute. Gusty winds combined with wet snow will likely bring down some tree branches and lead to power outages.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
